definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

sentences.english: If you do not care about your love machine , used vegetable oil , such as points, I will not object.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不在乎你的愛機，用點菜油之類的我也不反對。

sentences.english: The waitress appeared, "Are you ready to order?""
sentences.chinese: 女服務員走了過來，“佝們準備好點菜了嗎？”

sentences.english: Or is the icky-cleanup half worth more than the taking-my-order half?
sentences.chinese: 還是清理的比點菜的要值多點？

sentences.english: Would you like the dinner or a la carte?
sentences.chinese: 你要喫客飯或者要點菜？

sentences.english: How do you choose what to eat in a restaurant?
sentences.chinese: 你去餐館喫飯時是如何點菜的？

sentences.english: There is the waiter who takes the order and conveys it to the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 比如記錄點菜並將記錄單傳給廚房的服務員。

sentences.english: Residents are also welcome to order meals from local restaurants to enjoy in-suite.
sentences.chinese: 居民也歡迎到當地餐館點菜享受套房。

sentences.english: Asking if a diner is ready to order.
sentences.chinese: 詢問就餐者是否準備點菜了。

sentences.english: Our last order is at 10P. M. Could you arrive before then, please?
sentences.chinese: 我們到十點停止接受點菜，請在十點以前光臨。
實際上你點菜點得太多。

sentences.english: If the restaurant is busy and your child is shy, please order for him.
sentences.chinese: 如果餐館很忙而你的孩子很害羞，那你就給他點菜。

sentences.english: Gourmet a la carte dining is available in the main dining room or on the verandas.
sentences.chinese: 照單點菜的美食可在餐廳或者走廊上享用。

sentences.english: Professional meal ordering guides are the results of customer-oriented demand.
sentences.chinese: 職業點菜師是順應以顧客爲導向的市場需求而出現的。

sentences.english: As usual they sat at the table reserved for them and ordered their lunch.
sentences.chinese: 像往常一樣，他們坐在預定的桌前，點菜喫午飯。

sentences.english: Actually, you've ordered too much. We can't finish it all.
sentences.chinese: 實際上你點菜點得太多，我們都喫不完。

sentences.english: We have both buffet-style and a la carte dishes, which would you prefer?
sentences.chinese: 我們有自助式和點菜式，您喜歡哪一種？

definition: (at a restaurant) to order a meal/(of a waiter) to take an order
to pay the bill/to settle accounts/also written 結賬|结账
to pay the bill (in a restaurant etc) (loanword from Cantonese)/(fig.) to bear responsibility
sales counter/front desk/bar/(of markets, medicines etc) OTC (over-the-counter)
take-out (fast food)/(outer part of) tire/as well/besides/into the bargain/outer zone
to pay the bill/to settle accounts/also written 結帳|结帐
to have a meal/to eat/to make a living
as one wishes/as one pleases/at random/negligent/casual/wanton
